item.title: Add model command -.-
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Someone using your client made it so you have to type :: before it.

Notice this line: inputString = “::” + inputString;

And this: if(inputString.equals(“add model”)) {

All in all, just do “::add model (id)”

Read full topic

item.title: Add model command -.-
item.dc:creator: @patargangstar patargangstar
item.description:
@patargangstar wrote:

ok so ive looked and ive looked and ive looked everyone says just type “add model (id)”
bla bla bla
i have the command CLIENT SIDED before anyone sugests that and it is “add model”

if(inputString.startsWith("/")) inputString = "::" + inputString; if(inputString.equals("add model")) { try { int ModelIndex = Integer.parseInt(JOptionPane.showInputDialog(this, "Enter model ID", "Model", 3)); byte[] abyte0 = getModel(ModelIndex); if(abyte0 != null && abyte0.length > 0) { decompressors[1].method234(abyte0.length, abyte0, ModelIndex); pushMessage("Model: [" + ModelIndex + "] added successfully!", 0, ""); } else { pushMessage("Unable to find the model. "+ModelIndex, 0, ""); } } catch(Exception e) { pushMessage("Syntax - ::add model <path>", 0, ""); } }

but the model im trying to add i say
add model 62692
and it does nothing just makes me say add model 62692
as a side note when i put models into my “raw” folder then load my client it makes my client crash on loading with that client has encountered a problem loading screen (may be the problem? cause i have to load the client THEN add the model to the raw folder if you think so suggestions on how to fix?)
thanks in advance!
